snippet: The American arm of the ING Group, the Dutch financial services firm, priced its initial public offering at $19.50 a share, below its expected range of $21 to $24. But with nearly $1.3 billion in proceeds, the deal is the second-biggest I.P.O. in the...
abstract: The American arm of the ING Group, the Dutch financial services firm, priced its initial public offering at $19.50 a share, below its expected range of $21 to $24. But with nearly $1.3 billion in proceeds, the deal is the second-biggest I.P.O. in the United States this year.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: ING's U.S. Unit Prices Its Market Debut Below Expectations
